page.title: 19Tapps hotel
page.content: {TAPPS}_ THIS FINE EXAMPLE OF VICTORIAN ARCHITECTURE WAS BUILT JUST OVER 115 YEARS AGO AS A HOME FOR HERBERT JAMES MEDLYCOTT, THE VICAR.THE NEW LARGE VICARAGE WAS NEEDED TO ACCOMMODATE HIS EVER_INCREASING FAMILY AT THE SAME TIME ENABLING THE PREVIOUS VICARAGE TO BE DEMOLISHED TO MAKE WAY FOR THE EXTENSION TO THE CHURCH. {TAPPS}REMAINED THE VICARAGE UNTIL THE MID_THIRTIES WHEN THE CURRENT VICARAGE WAS BUILT ON THE OTHER SIDE OF THE STREAM,NEARER TO THE CHURCH.THE HOUSE WAS PURCHASED BY THE HON MRS BRAMWELL ,WHO LIVED HERE FOR OVER 20 YEARS. THE ORIGINAL CARRIAGE ENTRANCE CAN STILL BE SEEN ON THE{NORTH BOUNDARY.} IT BECAME ESSENTIAL TO CLOSE THIS AS THE{A30}DEVELOPED INTO A MAJOR TRUNK ROAD FOR HOLIDAY MAKERS GOING TO DEVON AND CORNWALL.IT IS NOW USED AS A HOTEL,RESTAURANT AND NIGHT CLUB.
